revised_title: Electrical and Thermal Conductivities of Monovalent Metals: A Revised Theory
tldr: This article presents a revised theory for the electrical and thermal conductivities of monovalent metals, focusing on the case of sodium. The authors take into account various objections and modifications to the Bloch theory, providing a more complete and consistent quantitative account of the transport properties of these metals. While the theory does not give exact numerical agreement with observations, it offers a better understanding of the underlying mechanisms involved in the conductivities of monovalent metals.
